thread.title: Mufti seeks ‘credible enquiry’ into Haj incidents
thread.title_full: Mufti seeks ‘credible enquiry’ into Haj incidents

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Mufti seeks ‘credible enquiry’ into Haj incidents
text:
Ehsan Fazili Tribune News Service
Srinagar, October 3
Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mufti Mohammad Sayeed on Saturday called for a “credible enquiry” into two tragic incidents during the Haj pilgrimage in which nearly 1,200 pilgrims died at the holy city of Mecca in Saudi Arabia last month.
“I appeal to the Saudi Government that there should be a credible inquiry into these accidents and care should be taken, so that such incidents do not take place in the future,” Mufti Mohammad Sayeed said addressing the State Legislative Assembly while concluding obituary references on the first day of the legislature session here.
Mufti, while addressing separately in both the Assembly and Council, held that there should not be any “blame game” on the two major tragedies. At least 107 pilgrims died in a cane crash in Mecca, while at least 1,090 pilgrims died at Mina on the last leg of the pilgrimage this year. At least 636 others were reported missing in these incidents, the Chief Minister said.
Earlier, Speaker Kavinder Gupta made obituary references on the demise of the former President of India, APJ Abdul Kalam and nine other former ministers and members of the Legislative Assembly and Council on the first day of the autumn session.
After the Speaker made references on the life and achievements of the members who passed away since the last session, the Minister for Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs, Basharat Ahmad Bukhari, sought to include obituary on the death of the Haj pilgrims.
